related_post.text: If I have a struct like the one below what is the best way to cycle through or to process each struct property without hardcoding each thing I want to do? I have an example of what I mean below the struct```type IncomingStruct struct { PropOne string  PropTwo string  PropThree string  PropFour string  PropFive string }```I can\'t alter the struct for legacy reasons but I have to take each value and process it. Right now that looks like this and I don\'t want to have to continue hardcoding stuff.```ret = append(ret s.processValue("lookup_for_prop_one incoming.PropOne))ret = append(ret s.processValue("lookup_for_prop_two incoming.PropTwo))ret = append(ret s.processValue("lookup_for_prop_three incoming.PropThree))ret = append(ret s.processValue("lookup_for_prop_four incoming.PropFour))ret = append(ret s.processValue("lookup_for_prop_five incoming.PropFive))```I am not sure how to accomplish this. I found this SO question but it seems like a lot of reflection and stuff would be overly complicated: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18926303/iteratethroughthefieldsofastructingo
